attributes.action: Make it a criminal act for any British politician to lie or deceive UK citizens
attributes.background: Politicians seem to be able to say what they want without being held to account, if there was some kind of criminal action that can be taken to insure a little bit more truth in their actions and words. Perhaps this force them to be honest with the British public.

attributes.action: Make it requirement for takeaways & restaurants to display food hygiene ratings
attributes.background: As a country we should enforce ALL places where food is handled to display their food hygiene rating. Food hygiene is crucial and diseases and infections can occur from "poor hygiene" - we as paying customers have the right to know how hygienic our food is respectively.
attributes.additional_details:
It is a known fact that poor food hygiene is associated with serious cases of food poisoning and this could mean having to seek medical evaluation, if you have ever suffered from this you would know it is an unpleasant experience, and it is commonly associated with with pathogens such as Salmonella.
As paying customers we deserve the right to know the standard of hygiene that out food was prepared in respectively. 
This should also motivate those poor establishments to up their standards.

attributes.action: Reduce Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP
attributes.background: I propose we reduce the Foreign Aid budget to 0.5% of GDP then put those savings into NHS, Policing, Armed Forces, Schools & Infra-structure in equal proportions.
attributes.additional_details:
We currently put 0.7% of our GDP into Foreign Aid, which is ok when we can afford it but the needs of our Country must come first.
It is the duty of the Government to put the security of the nation first that means increasing the funding for our Armed Forces.
It is also the duty of our Government to ensure the safety of its people that means increasing the funding for our Police.
Until our Road networks are repaired, our Hospitals upgraded, our schools rebuilt and our Police and Armed Forces are fully equipped to defend our Nation the reduce Foreign Aid Budget should remain.
Once we have rebuilt these vital services we can once again increase our Foreign Aid budget on the understanding that it is fully audited and overseen by our Armed Forces, that way we can see how our money is spent

attributes.action: Make supermarkets supply a point in store to discard excessive packaging
attributes.background: Facility to remove excessive amount of packaging within the store. Force a change to packaging habits by supermarkets and prevent contamination of products to be recycled

attributes.action: Have GMT all year round.
attributes.background:
An extra hour in bed every day for six months of the year.

The correct time for our longitude.

attributes.action: Ban non 'diet' fizzy drinks having sweeteners in them
attributes.background:
Since the introduction of the sugar tax companies have been changing recipes for their standard drinks to reduce the amount of sugar by adding sweeteners.
For many people who either do not want to drink a 'diet' drink this has become very confusing and in most cases you cannot buy a drink without.
attributes.additional_details:
An example is the halving of Sugar in Lucozade (a recommended drink for people with diabetes to combat hypoglycaemic events). 
Or drinks labled 'Regular' or 'Classic' now contain sweetener although there are already no added sugar or diet versions.

The sugar tax has reduced a consumers choice so it is near impossible to buy a drink without sweeteners and it is already being shown that they cause as much a health risk as too much sugar. 
Moderation is the way forward not lack of choice.

attributes.action: Require and fund access for disabled witnesses in all courts.
attributes.background: Disabled people should have access to all courts in the UK which should comply with The Equality Act 2010. Courts have a duty to make these adjustments ,removing barriers restricting the access that prevents people with disabilities being able to attend court, however this isn’t always the case.
attributes.additional_details:
People with disabilities have the same rights as able bodied people, and should receive the same level of service. If these measures are not put in place, this should be known as unlawful discrimination. This prevents people with disabilities from continuing with the criminal justice system. This should be implemented for both the witness and the defendant. 
Ramp access through the entire court should be standard. 
I could not access the witness door because it had a step, this led me to, “bump” into my abuser. I had to sit very close to him with a screen but could still hear his breath as I was answering questions.

attributes.action: Make emotional abuse and bullying a criminal offence
attributes.background: Unless there has been a threat of violence, nothing can be done to stop emotional abuse. This seriously affects mental health. This is a major problem for ex-partners and their children. Emotional abuse should be illegal.
attributes.additional_details: It is also not possible for someone to leave their job for bullying and to go onto job seeker's allowance despite this affecting their mental health due to this not currently being seen as an issue.

attributes.action: Make nutrition a mandatory subject for children to learn in schools.
attributes.background: Making nutrition a mandatory subject in schools will help in the growing obesity rates in children and adults, this will lead to less of a strain on the NHS in the future.

attributes.action: Give EU citizens working in the NHS free indefinite leave to remain in the UK.
attributes.background:
The possibility of a "no-deal" Brexit has been described as uncomfortably high. 
There are a significant number of EU citizens working in the NHS.  Any disruption in their working rights may have catastrophic effects. The government should give them indefinite leave to remain for free.
attributes.additional_details:
There are more than 60,000 NHS staff who are EU citizens. At present, there is no assurance that they can continue working post Brexit. This makes recruitment of staff challenging. 
The suggested £65 fee represents more than one day's earnings for the majority of them and cannot be justified for administration purposes.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to have lifeguards on all popular beaches in the UK
attributes.background: Too many people are dying in the sea, if there was lifeguards around there wouldn't be so many deaths.

attributes.action: Legalise the usage and possession of Psychedelic drugs.
attributes.background:
There is astounding reports of these substances changing many people's lives, tackling depression and mental health issues.
We would like the laws reevaluated in order for proper clinical testing to take place.
We believe these substances will have a great impact in the field of psychiatry.
attributes.additional_details:
Dimethyltryptamine is a naturally occurring chemical in all of nature's plants. The human body is said to possibly produce this chemical and we currently do not know enough about this substance due to its legal status.

Research needs to be done into the potential medicinal benefits of this substance to tackle chronic depression etc.

attributes.action: Make it a requirement that airlines provide carbon emissions information.
attributes.background: At the moment, many people take flights without realising the environmental impact of their actions. Without information on this, it is difficult to begin to raise awareness of this problem. Carbon emissions information when you book a flight would be a good start.

attributes.action: Use paper-based assessments for those DWP claimants who have been through abuse.
attributes.background: Abuse & Child Sexual Exploitation leaves a remaining scar on those who have been through the issue, meaning that talking about it can be extremely traumatic. It makes those who have been through CSE relive the events of that trauma, impacting not only their physical but mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
The current interview process is damaging for CSE victims. As a CSE victim I was ignored by the DWP. I was promised a Mental Health Nurse assessment and didn't see one. The general nurse didn't understand my issues. A paper-based assessment would protect victims from reliving trauma. 
Health Impacts of Child Sexual Exploitation - http://www.barnardos.org.uk/health_impacts_of_child_sexual_exploitation.pdf 

The Impact of CSE https://paceuk.info/about-cse/the-impact-of-child-sexual-exploitation/ 
Long Term Effects of CSE - https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.3109/01612848909140847

attributes.action: British National (Overseas) Citizens should be given full British Citizenship.
attributes.background: People in Hong Kong who hold the British National (Overseas) passport are British; however, the British government is refusing and avoiding giving these Hong Kongers the right of abode in the United Kingdom nor in any of the British territories. Many of them were forced to become PROC Chinese.
attributes.additional_details: The Chinese government is ignoring the Sino Anglo Agreements signed in 1981. It could be a disaster if we keep ignoring this is happening. Hong Kongers will come in as political refugees. We will need a lot of effort to house them and bad for the British reputations to the International community then.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of rat poison to prevent its misuse to protect other animals
attributes.background: There are frequent cases of the misuse of rat poison resulting in the poisoning of dogs, cats and other animals. There are other ways in which rats can be controlled so I would like to see the sale and use of Rat Poison banned.
attributes.additional_details: A simple search of the internet will find multiple cases.

attributes.action: Call on Parliament to censure President Trump for his policy choices
attributes.background: We call on Parliament to use the opportunity of President Trump's visit to the UK to condemn in the strongest terms his policy choices. We ask that Parliament pass a motion which makes clear our opposition to his regressive policies.
attributes.additional_details:
The Muslim ban. Separating families at the border. Pulling out of the Paris agreement and the Iran deal. Starting trade wars. His approach to the media. Saying there were 'fine people on both sides' following the white nationalist rally in Charlottesville. His response to NFL protests against police violence. These are just a handful of the President's political choices that many people in the UK find troubling. 

We call on our representatives to make clear that we do not support these views.

attributes.action: Re-think the current legislation criminalising cannabis.
attributes.background: The governments response to a similar petition stated that they are basing policy on a 10 year old report done under labour, I'm asking the government to re-think this policy by conducting a new, up to date and relevant study to bring our legislation up to modern standards.

attributes.action: Students doing history GCSE's should learn 5 units for History instead of 4.
attributes.background: I personally am a strong believer that GCSE's currently are just a test of memory, and the hardest working students should be segregated from those who's efforts are inadequate.
attributes.additional_details: From the information I have acquired from students doing the 2018 GCSE History examinations, doing 4 units of history was not challenging for them and the task was too easily completed. They knew that they were not being tested to their full potential of memorisation and would be interested in doing an extra unit. Additionally, a fifth unit would not only further test the exam skills of each candidate, but would also help in ensuring those who succeed are the very best and most hardworking.

attributes.action: Do not remain in the EEA
attributes.background:
Remaining in the EEA will stop the UK becoming the sovereign nation that was voted for in the referendum.
All the promises of new trade deals will become token at best.
Nations outside of the EU has warned against staying in the EU like this and we demand parliament does as was told by the people.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theaustralian.com.au/national-affairs/alexander-downer-warns-uk-of-irrelevancy-over-soft-brexit-plans/news-story/c967595695165c994395d81fbb91e100

attributes.action: UK Government to work with the devolved assemblies to create UK free bus travel
attributes.background: Those who are 60 years and over can get free bus travel in Wales Scotland Northern Ireland and London while the rest of UK citizens have to pay. This surely is unfair on those of us who rely on bus travel for work and leisure in England. Please sign this petition to bring in a national standard
attributes.additional_details: Many people aged 60 and over struggle to pay the cost of bus travel. It makes sense to bring in a UK standard for all .This would also help with road congestion and therefore help to reduce pollution from car emissions. It should also improve bus services due to the extra demand by this age group.  Many other countries  actively promote the use of public transport to free up congested roads especially with  Hydrogen and Electric powered public transport.Cleaner air makes  a better environment

attributes.action: Abolish university fees
attributes.background: We want to abolish university fees as they are causing people to miss out on education and potentially life changing careers. The fact that people cant get the proper education to become a doctor or lawyer etc. isn't fair as it means that only the wealthy can achieve the careers they want.
attributes.additional_details:
Tuition fees at public university are at the highest on average. This means that 17772 people can't afford to go to university. 

Since 1998 university fees have been drastically rising, starting at £1000 and then in 2006 they rose to £3000 and recently have been raised to £9000 a year on average.

attributes.action: Ban over taking on the A35 one of Dorset’s most dangerous roads!
attributes.background: The a35 Dorset between Poole and Bere Regis is fast becoming one of Dorset’s deadliest roads. We have seen many deaths and road closures over the last few years and now it’s time to keep the road users safe. Make this road a no over taking policy road and reduce the speed limit.

attributes.action: Increase funding for dementia research to find effective treatments.
attributes.background: Alzheimer's Research UK calls on the government to put 1% of the total annual cost of dementia towards dementia research each year to urgently find an effective treatment.  Dementia is the leading cause of death in the UK and without an effective treatment death rates will continue to rise.
attributes.additional_details: Dementia research lags behind other major disease areas, like cancer and heart disease, which have seen greater support for research and increased survival rates in recent decades.  Government puts only the equivalent of 0.3% of the annual cost of dementia towards research compared to 1.6% for cancer research and 0.9% for coronary heart disease.  With no way to prevent, cure or even slow down the diseases that cause dementia, government must increase research to find a new treatment.
attributes.creator_name: Helen Davies on behalf of Alzheimer's Research UK

attributes.action: Review eligibility(prior degree) for the Masters loan for the LLM Legal Practice
attributes.background: A long distance Masters degree, which I struggled to pay for in instalments, has now made me ineligible to apply for a Postgraduate loan to study the Legal Practice Course, which I need to become a solicitor. I now face trying to fund this course via expensive loans or not qualifying at all.
attributes.additional_details: Law graduates who struggled to privately fund a Masters as they could not afford the LPC, are not-eligible for the Post graduate loan. The LPC is the main practice course which enables them become Solicitors. The additional LLM on top of the Legal Practice Course(LPC) is an additional dissertation to qualify the LPC for the Masters Loan. I pray that the eligibilty rule which exempts Law graduates with a previous higher qualification from applying for a Masters loan to study the LPC be reviewed.

attributes.action: Extend the maximum length of a caravan towed by a 3.5 tonne vehicle from 7m
attributes.background: The current law stops you towing a caravan more than 7m long with anything less than 3.5 tonne vehicle when a lot of vehicles less than 3.5 tonne are capable of towing these caravans
attributes.additional_details: There seems to be more and more caravans now especially foreign caravans that are more than 7m long these can currently only be towed with a vehicle more than 3.5 tonne a lot of people still tow illegally with less than 3.5 tonne as most campsites don’t allow Comercial vehicles so this makes it hard to stay legal and still be able to enjoy using bigger family friendly caravans

attributes.action: Have another vote on leaving the EU. Canada-style agreement or no deal?
attributes.background: If the Chequers agreement is rejected, I feel the people should have a vote on what happens next, which is why I feel we should get a vote on the UK and EU agreeing an EU/Canada-style comprehensive economic and trade agreement or no deal.

attributes.action: Create minimum wage for SIA holders to be paid £15 per hour.
attributes.background: How many SIA staff would like to be paid a minimum of £15 per hour?
attributes.additional_details: Comments later, just sign up everyone.

attributes.action: Make it law for all restaurants to provide Braille menus.
attributes.background: Why should people not have the option to read a menu? Perhaps it's something that we sighted people take for granted. In order for visually impaired people to gain more independence, it's important that they're actually able to read a menu for themselves.

attributes.action: Don’t scrap the 1p or 2p coin
attributes.background: Recently there have been calls for the 1p and 2p coin to be scrapped. I believe that this would have a huge effect of the UK public, This would mean any tax increases would jump to a minimum of 5p, that has an effect on petrol prices, shop prices would increase, leaving the British public worse off.
attributes.additional_details: Supermarkets etc would increase prices by 5p per item when they do increase a price, for eg, Mr & Mrs Public go shopping to their local supermarket, the store has had a store wide increase on tinned goods, so the couple buy 20 tins of varied products, all of which have had an increase of 5p, thats an extra £1 on that shop alone, £52 a year rise in costs, that’s just on one example of shopping, let alone the other rises, to jump from a 1p rise to a 5p rise is too much for a lot of people.

attributes.action: Revisit the NHS Pay Deal 2018 as the initial communications were misleading
attributes.background: The detail released to NHS staff and Unions from NHS Employers was misleading and staff and unions have voted based on the information initially provided. This has resulted in large numbers of staff not receiving a 6% pay increase over 3 years as communicated.

attributes.action: Beat corporate tax avoidance by introducing Sales Tax based on Delivery Address
attributes.background: Big companies like Amazon, with turnovers in the UK in the billions, get away with paying next to no corporation tax.  Introduce a Delivery Sales Tax, based on the postcode being delivered to.  Claw back this money which is currently flowing overseas.  We could do this by monitoring at the courier.
attributes.additional_details:
It would be simple to legislate to require delivery companies to keep a log of:

a) Origin Company
b) Delivery Postcode
c) Declared value of item
d) Unique Shipping ID

Issue each company with an annual tax bill based on a fair percentage of the total value of all items delivered in the UK.

Failure to declare adequate value of a package would invalidate its insurance.

Spot checks would be simple - make occasional test orders to random addresses.  Incorrect declarations would be fined harshly.

attributes.action: Make £2.00 the most any catering company/school/borough can charge for hot food
attributes.background: I would like the UK government to introduce a maximum that any school ,catering company or borough can charge students to eat the hot food or main meal that the school serves.
attributes.additional_details: The price of hot food in schools across the UK has increased by an average of 5% over the past 4 years.The unjust increase means that some children have to buy food from shops, which would be harmless if  the food that children were buying was healthy but that isn't the case unfortunately in most situations snacks like crisps sweets and biscuits are less healthy than an actual meal but are a lot less expensive.Adults have pay to much for school food.

attributes.action: Don't sell Linton-on-ouse
attributes.background: Keep RAF Linton on ouse open it's the best fast jet training facility

attributes.action: Make gay conversion therapy a criminal offence
attributes.background:
Gay conversion therapy is currently legal in the UK

No one should be told that their sexual orientation, their identity, is a an illness that needs to be cured.
attributes.additional_details:
Following a journalist's report on gay conversion therapy at a church in Liverpool the government has devised a 75 point action plan to improve the lives of the LGBT community. The plan states that the government will set out to ban such therapies but doesn't say how this is going to be enforced.

You can't simply just tell people not to do something and hope that it works, because it doesn't. Something more needs to be done. We urge the government to criminalise gay conversion therapy.

attributes.action: Allow student nurses to receive 4 yearly instalments of their maintenance loan.
attributes.background: Most academic years of degrees start at mid to late September and end in May meaning three yearly instalments is ok for them. Nursing students don't end until August and start their next year in the same month! They are expected to survive on the same as those who aren't in the same situations.
attributes.additional_details: Three instalments does not give a student nurse enough support to fund their accommodation or basic health and wellbeing!

attributes.action: Make March 29th a public holiday from March 29th 2019
attributes.background: this is the day we officially leave the EU therefore it is only fitting that one of the most important days in modern history is marked as a national holiday.
attributes.additional_details:
Speaker John Bercow said the EU (Withdrawal) Bill, which repeals the 1972 European Communities Act through which Britain became a member of the bloc, had received royal assent from Queen Elizabeth II.

The bill transfers decades of European law onto British statute books, and also enshrines Brexit day in British law as March 29, 2019 at 11pm (2300 GMT) -- midnight Brussels time.

Prime Minister Theresa May said the approval was a "historic moment for our country, and a significant step towards delivering on the will of the British people".

attributes.action: Keep Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses
attributes.background: Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses are only allowed by certain Councils at the moment. Because you mention a Circus has Animals in it certain Councils want to Ban them i hope my Petition will stop this from happening and let this tradition continue
attributes.additional_details: Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses could range from Dogs, Cats to Budgies and Horses that come from Outside the UK that forms part of a Travelling Circuses Act and will only be allowed if the Animals coming into the UK have been Inspected by the RSPCA/SSPCA etc and only then will Horses from outside be allowed in Travelling Circuses.

attributes.action: Place a price ceiling on the cost of therapeutic oxygen for inflight use.
attributes.background: I suffer from a collection of  congenital heart defects which means that I require the use of therapeutic oxygen when I fly on an aircraft. The cost of this is upwards from £50 per flight. Some airlines ask you to provide your own oxygen through a private company which costs around £300 per week.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe that the travel industry is capitalising on peoples illnesses, and receiving a huge profit on the sale of therapeutic oxygen, which is essential a bottle of air, as medical grade oxygen is available to purchase for £6.64 on the BOC website. 
https://www.boconline.co.uk/shop/en/uk/healthcare/medical-gas/oxygen-cylinder-medical-grade-compressed-gas
 I am calling for a price limit to be placed on therapeutic inflight oxygen as it is unfair for the industry to make money off my illness.

attributes.action: Make cyclists require a cycling licence that they must carry at all times.
attributes.background: I have nearly been hit three times by cyclists going at high speed around corners. Cyclists never use bells anymore so silently sneak up on you and shoot past (on the pavement).
attributes.additional_details: Many people have called for regulation of cycling. This has been impractical as bikes do not need reg numbers (like cars) but this proposal is new. I propose that cyclists themselves should have to purchase a licence from the DVLA which can be revoked if guilty of dangerous cycling.

attributes.action: Make public stadiums and arenas ban or charge for single use plastic cups.
attributes.background: Make all stadiums, public arenas and any venue using plastic cups/bottles either ban the use of these and use a paper alternative or have a deposit scheme where a charge is applied for anyone using a plastic cup/bottle and is refunded when the cup/bottle is returned.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastic takes between 500-1000 years to degrade.

50% of sea turtles have consumed plastic.

1,000,000 sea birds and 100,000 marine animals are killed each year due to plastic waste.

There is more micro-plastic in the sea then stars in the Milky Way.

Single use bags, Straws, cups and bottle are the most common type of plastic pollution found in the ocean.

All the plastic that has ever been made is still around in one shape or another (excluding that which has been incinerated)

attributes.action: FREE sanitary products for women with endometriosis
attributes.background: 1 in 10 women of reproductive age in the UK suffer from endometriosis. 10% of women world wide have endometriosis - that's 176 million worldwide. Women with endometriosis usually experience extremely heavy and painful periods and can go through as many as 20 night time pads in an average day.

attributes.action: Ban Smoking on streets
attributes.background: Smoking on the streets is bad for other people through passive smoking and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It was proven that when the indoor smoking ban was brought into force over 700,000 people stopped smoking

attributes.action: Lower car tax and fuel benefit for diesel company cars after this years tax hike
attributes.background: The company car has become a cash cow for the government over the last few years. Many field representatives earn modest salaries, and have job cars where they have no choice of  model, engine type, etc. I would like to see the system made more fair after this years massive increase in tax.

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers include the potassium content and Phosphate on labels.
attributes.background: People with Heart/Renal problems need to be mindful of the food they are eating making sure they do not consume to much potassium and phosphate, however this information is largely unknown by the manufacture. This petition aims to make the food manufacturers make this information readily available.

attributes.action: Increase funding for schools with SEN students.
attributes.background: We are a GCSE Citizenship group and we feel that, due to the recent school budget cuts, Special education needs students are not getting the full support that they deserve, because the funding has been cut for them.
attributes.additional_details:
Our school has been greatly effected by the cuts, and we are now having to use other students money to support these SEN students. If this cause was bought before Parliament, we could increase the spending on SEN students and they would not have to suffer any more than they already are. We have lost £279 per student and we are losing more to help other students.

Our aims are to get as many signatures as possible and hopefully get local MP's behind us.
Please help us.

attributes.action: Review the unfair school fine system where 2 parent families pay twice
attributes.background: The penalty for taking a child out of school is on a per person, per child basis. This means two parent families have to pay the fine twice. This is unfair and should be reviewed.

attributes.action: Stop childcare providers charging parents when they are closed or have holiday.
attributes.background: This is a petition to stop parents being held to ransom by childcare providers! Currently nurseries/child minders are allowed to charge parents up to a full days rate for care when they are closed for bank holidays, staff training and xmas. Resulting in working parents taking holiday or upaid leave.

attributes.action: Introduce National Conscription with the opportunity to volunteer overeseas.
attributes.background: It seems it would be more constructive to direct school leavers at 16 or 18 to have the opportunity to be part of a group who provide the opportunity to engage in social positive role model building than to be unemployed and idle when so much help is needed across society. A better use of gov money.
attributes.additional_details: Knife crime, scooter mugging, drug taking and obesity are all escalating issues amongst young people both as perpetrators and victims. National Conscription for one year with the opporuntiy to volunteer abroad could be such a constructive initiative following the lead of Norway, Denmark and Israel - three of the happiest, most disciplined, best-educated countries in the world. Germany, France and Italy are considering something similar.

attributes.action: Regulate the transfer of terminally people ill from home to palliative care.
attributes.background: Transfers from home to palliative care usually involve a number of public and commercial services, each following their own safeguarding procedures. However, if serious omissions are to be avoided there is a pressing need for a mechanism which locks these different safeguarding procedures together.
attributes.additional_details:
A central Government initiative, in the form of national protocol or code of practice, would help to ensure that certain standards are achieved by all those involved in transferring the terminally ill from home to palliative care.

Any central Government protocol or code of practice would need to be embedded in the various safeguarding procedures and this should lead to improved collaboration, better communication and a more collaborative way of working for all those involved.
